Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact reported by the Associated Press that income inequality grew to its largest in 50 years.
Understate: The claim understates the severity of income inequality by suggesting that all four measures of income inequality shrunk, without providing sufficient evidence or context.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate its assertion that income inequality has decreased based on the new Census report.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the new Census report is more accurate and reliable than the information reported by the Associated Press without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents an alternative explanation to the Associated Press report by suggesting that the new Census report shows a decline in income inequality.
